id: BTS’s V breaks down in tears on stage over illness as #GetWellSoonTaehyung trends
paragraph: 135.6m sharesBTS have been working non-stop in 2018 thanks to the release of their two albums and their world tour – so it’s only natural they may be feeling under the weather.But being struck with illness got to V as the band performed in Paris.The K-pop boyband performed their second last European date in France’s Accorhotels Arena on 19 October, and the ARMY was out in force, flooding social media with videos and pictures from the concert.However, V is believed to have been suffering from a cold, a cough and a sore throat, and the 22-year-old was left in tears when he struggled to keep up with the challenging high notes and energy required for BTS’s routines.During The Truth Untold, Taehyung was seen visibly upset as he dealt with his illness, while he broke down in tears during the finale of Love Myself.Wearing a beret as a nod to Paris, V wiped away tears as he waved to the ARMY – and fans were just as emotional.#GetWellSoonTaehyung began trending on Twitter as ARMYs tweeted messages of support for the idol.@BTS_twt To #V  please don't cry seeying you crying broke my heart  😭😭😭😭We all know you're a wonderful & a great singer we support you & love you please don't be sad this thing can happend to anyone . Thank you for you're hard work i love you #V forever pic.twitter.com/AKrSt6AFP6— Chichi Chahrouz (@chahrouz) October 19, 2018This is breaking my heart 💔Why are you crying #taehyung :'( pic.twitter.com/C9hiPgAj3i— ￣サミ【V】➷￣LOVE YOU TAEHYUNG💜 (@ipurple_tae) October 19, 2018MY TAETAE CRYING😭😭 Pleasee don't cry,Your tears are precious to my heart 💔💔#kimtaehyung #BTS #loveyouselftourfrance #LoveYourselfTour #v pic.twitter.com/Vol9UmDyRd— BTS💜 (@aseelbts19) October 19, 2018One tweet read: ‘So he was crying because he is sick and couldn’t sing much. Baby we’re always here for you it’s okay,you guys did a lot to us it’s not just the music you really make us happy V.’Another person wrote: ‘To V please don’t cry seeing you crying broke my heart’, while one tweet read: ‘We all know you’re a wonderful & a great singer we support you & love you please don’t be sad this thing can happen to anyone . Thank you for your hard work.’While he was feeling under the weather, V still managed to put a smile on the faces of French ARMYs by speaking in their language.He said: ‘Je t’aime davantage, aujourd’hui plus qu’hier et bien moins que demain’ (I love you more than yesterday but less than tomorrow)’ – a quote from Rosemonde Gerard’s poem L’Eternelle Chanson.BTS Jimin’s T-shirt controversy isn't the first K-pop-related historical blunder'There's no just being happy or just being sad': RAVI continues to break the mouldE'Dawn confirmed to leave Cube Entertainment as agency terminates contractBTS have battled through illness and injury while on their European tour, starting with Jungkook, who injured his heel hours before the band’s first concert in London.The maknae required stitches, and was forced to sit out the choreography, sitting on a stool on a moving platform for the two London gigs.Then, Jimin pulled out of BTS’s appearance on The Graham Norton Show due to ‘severe muscle pain’.
